item.title: DarkQuest (Officially back and online)
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:94, topic:255285”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=337336.msg2781843#msg2781843 date=1242037782]

If you would be interested in sharing small pieces of your source, the few of us that would benefit from learning what you have figured out would appreciate it.

If you have a question, come on IRC (irc.securitychat.org #rscdev) and ask me (Pets on IRC) and I’ll probably help (depending if its an actual question or a person just being lazy and not googeling). If you want something done / want pieces of my code, come on IRC and ask, but bring a wallet.
[/quote]It comes time when enough free/open source software is around that more is going to cost money.

RSCD is leaked/released and free. I’m pretty sure expecting anything more free comes close to greedy especially with what little amount of higher-end developers there are in this community .

Sucks that RSCD is around, would have been nice as a community to get together to create something.

Geminus ftw.

But it’s not like it’s too late to create a new base.

Metaphore: Just because facebook took the world by storm and dominated social networking sites doesn’t mean Myspace/Bebo is going to shut itself down.[/quote]

Yeah well I cross MySpace Tweet with Twitter!

Not really.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest (Officially back and online)
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

In the end, why should it matter who leeches who?

Why must one take “credit” when what they have was done by several other people, each successively building upon another. Is each developer of that server emulator listed or only the past two or three? Creating an entirely new emulator from scratch is one thing and creditworthy. Anything else is puerile.

The only way development has been able to get to where it is today has been because of leeching.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest (Officially back and online)
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Doubt it. Used to be interested in development when there was competition around / adding new stuff was a challenge. At the moment I’m in a state of “More or less been there, done that” on everything you can think of adding to your server.

Simply not fun any more.

item.title: DarkQuest (Officially back and online)
item.dc:creator: @Kozy Kozy
item.description:
@Kozy wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:72, topic:255285”][quote author=Ne0n X link=topic=337336.msg2739853#msg2739853 date=1239256583]

Peter this is a great game but you still need some name different than the one RSCD comes with. i know its yours but its called Marketing. The GUI the way you made its steals the GamePlay from the original game making the people doubt about playing, However adding features like, Clans, Dragon stuff seems a neat idea for players to be getting as their goal. All the players need is something to do

I’m an old developer of 3 MMO’s i coded and i got the experience enought to be telling you this. If you wish to make a team with me, or something, PM me

Greetings, Ne0n

I hope you readed my suggestions Peter.
You’re a nice coder
[/quote]
Don’t be stupid, he won’t team up with you.

Try to get someone elses server, then release it under a new name.[/quote]

Lmao, that made me laught xEnt =p.

DQ is the most developed server there is, IDK why nobody plays it.

-Kozy

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest (Officially back and online)
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Peter, post:74, topic:255285”]In celebration of Easter, we’ve decided to make a new event. When you log in, you’ll notice a fluffy bunny will be following you around. These bunnies lay an Easter egg every 2ish hours! Take care of these bunnies, as they might get lost, or stuck behind doors/walls!

I’d also like to note that we haven’t gone down once in a month! We are NOT going anywhere, so come on and play :).

P.S. We’re looking for forum moderators.[/quote]
epiiiiiiiiiiiic BUNNIES!

Read full topic
